update.description:
Notes:

* This PR requires Gazebo built from the `haptix_gui` branch (not to get the GUI plugin from there, but to use the changes that were made to Gazebo).

This PR moves the HaptixGUIPlugin from Gazebo back into handsim.  Had it stayed in Gazebo, it would have created a dependency from Gazebo on haptix-comm, to access the ignition-transport messages that it uses.

So what we have here is:

* @nkoenig 's new GUI
* plus a cleaned up rewrite of @jacquelinekay 's and my keyboard teleop

Note that we should now use the `arat.world` that's in here.  I've been launching Gazebo as:

    gazebo --verbose install/share/haptix_gazebo_plugins/worlds/arat.world

There might be a better way to handle that path.

It's working for me pretty much as before, though I made a couple of tweaks to the grasp mode switching.
update.title: Redo of teleop in GUI plugin

content.raw: Today I learned a valuable lesson about setting IGN_IP to the IP address of the correct network interface (or better yet, closing network interfaces that pop up mysteriously and cause haptix-comm to stop working). Turns out the issue preventing me from continuing my review is unrelated to this pull request!
content.html: Today I learned a valuable lesson about setting IGN_IP to the IP address of the correct network interface (or better yet, closing network interfaces that pop up mysteriously and cause haptix-comm to stop working). Turns out the issue preventing me from continuing my review is unrelated to this pull request!

content.raw:
While I was working on this, I saw the clock appear a couple of times, but not reliably.  I'm not sure, but it might have been that the clock was there when the `HaptixGUIPlugin` was not (I had some library loading trouble at first).  Maybe there's an ordering issue, with one sitting on top of and hiding the other?  If that's the case, then the fix likely needs to be made in Gazebo.

@nkoenig, any idea?
content.html:
While I was working on this, I saw the clock appear a couple of times, but not reliably. I'm not sure, but it might have been that the clock was there when the HaptixGUIPlugin was not (I had some library loading trouble at first). Maybe there's an ordering issue, with one sitting on top of and hiding the other? If that's the case, then the fix likely needs to be made in Gazebo.

@nkoenig, any idea?

pull_request.title: Redo of teleop in GUI plugin

pullrequest.title: Redo of teleop in GUI plugin

content.raw: The changes in 87195e6 look important for Polhemus-based camera control, but I don't see why those changes would be related to errors from calling `hx_getdeviceinfo()`.  Does the problem go away if you merge from that branch (`enums_remove_base_joint_calibrate`)?
content.html: The changes in 87195e6 look important for Polhemus-based camera control, but I don't see why those changes would be related to errors from calling hx_getdeviceinfo(). Does the problem go away if you merge from that branch (enums_remove_base_joint_calibrate)?

pullrequest.title: Redo of teleop in GUI plugin

content.raw:
I think there's a bugfix in 87195e6 (pull request $15) that is needed for this branch. When I compile it against gazebo branch haptix_gui and default for everything else, I get this message repeatedly:

[Dbg] [HaptixControlPlugin.cc:1032]  pausing polhemus [1]
hx_getdevicefo() Service call timed out.
[Err] [HaptixGUIPlugin.cc:715] hx_getdeviceinfo(): Request error. Cannot control hand.

I'll review the other pull request and continue testing this once it gets merged.
content.html:
I think there's a bugfix in 87195e6 (pull request $15) that is needed for this branch. When I compile it against gazebo branch haptix_gui and default for everything else, I get this message repeatedly:

[Dbg] [HaptixControlPlugin.cc:1032] pausing polhemus [1] hx_getdevicefo() Service call timed out. [Err] [HaptixGUIPlugin.cc:715] hx_getdeviceinfo(): Request error. Cannot control hand.

I'll review the other pull request and continue testing this once it gets merged.

pull_request.title: Redo of teleop in GUI plugin

pullrequest.title: Redo of teleop in GUI plugin

content.raw: ~~Will hard-coded widths make it difficult to make the GUI bar dynamically resizable?~~ nevermind--I realized this is a maximum width, so if we change the overlay to shrink dynamically based on the user's screen size, this won't be an issue. but that functionality should be in a future PR
content.html: Will hard-coded widths make it difficult to make the GUI bar dynamically resizable? nevermind--I realized this is a maximum width, so if we change the overlay to shrink dynamically based on the user's screen size, this won't be an issue. but that functionality should be in a future PR

content.raw:
At present, the 10cm block, the cups, and the marble are enabled, which is the plan that we agreed to (that last one in 92a48dd, courtesy of @jacquelinekay).  We're graying out tasks to keep people from trying things that don't work well.

How about we leave this as-is for now, and plan to tweak it as needed following testing?
content.html:
At present, the 10cm block, the cups, and the marble are enabled, which is the plan that we agreed to (that last one in 92a48dd, courtesy of @jacquelinekay). We're graying out tasks to keep people from trying things that don't work well.

How about we leave this as-is for now, and plan to tweak it as needed following testing?

pullrequest.title: Redo of teleop in GUI plugin

content.raw:
Looks good.  I recommend enabling the stone task, grasp 3 works well for it.

And once I get a working grasp for the marble task, I might propose enabling it as well.


What is the reason for greying out tasks?
content.html:
Looks good. I recommend enabling the stone task, grasp 3 works well for it.

And once I get a working grasp for the marble task, I might propose enabling it as well.

What is the reason for greying out tasks?

pull_request.title: Redo of teleop in GUI plugin

update.description:
Notes:

* This PR includes the changes in [PR 12](#!/osrf/handsim/pull-request/12); merge that one first.
* This PR requires Gazebo built from the `haptix_gui` branch (not to get the GUI plugin from there, but to use the changes that were made to Gazebo).

This PR moves the HaptixGUIPlugin from Gazebo back into handsim.  Had it stayed in Gazebo, it would have created a dependency from Gazebo on haptix-comm, to access the ignition-transport messages that it uses.

So what we have here is:

* @nkoenig 's new GUI
* plus a cleaned up rewrite of @jacquelinekay 's and my keyboard teleop

Note that we should now use the `arat.world` that's in here.  I've been launching Gazebo as:

    gazebo --verbose install/share/haptix_gazebo_plugins/worlds/arat.world

There might be a better way to handle that path.

It's working for me pretty much as before, though I made a couple of tweaks to the grasp mode switching.
update.title: (Merge #12 first) Redo of teleop in GUI plugin
